Capital: Athens Currency: Euro Prime minister: Alexis Tsipras Population: 11.03 million (2013) World Bank Official language: Greek

country.name: Germany

country.name: Australia
country.details: Australia Country Australia, officially the Commonwealth of Australia, is an Oceanian country comprising the mainland of the Australian continent, the island of Tasmania, and numerous smaller islands. It is the world's sixth-largest country by total area. Capital: Canberra Dialing code: +61 Currency: Australian dollar Governor-general: Peter Cosgrove Prime minister: Tony Abbott

country.name: Romania
country.details: Romania Country in Europe Romania is a central European country known for the forested region of Transylvania, preserved medieval towns such as Sighiֵoara and many fortified churches and castles, notably clifftop Bran Castle, long associated with the Dracula legend. The area is ringed by the Carpathian Mountains, which are popular for trekking, climbing, skiing and bathing in natural thermal spas. Capital: Bucharest Dialing code: +40 Currency: Romanian leu Continent: Europe Official language: Romanian

country.name: Mexico
country.details: Mexico Country in North America Mexico is a country between the U.S. and Central America beaches on its Pacific and Gulf of Mexico coastlines and a diverse landscape of mountains, deserts and jungles. Ancient ruins such as Teotihuacan (Aztec) and Chichen Itza (Mayan) are scattered throughout the country, as are Spanish colonial-era towns. In capital Mexico City, upscale shops, renowned museums and gourmet restaurants cater to modern life. Capital: Mexico City Dialing code: +52 Founded: September 27, 1821 Currency: Mexican peso President: Enrique Peֳ±a Nieto
